recent_reviews.content:
We had such a nice meal there the first day of our holiday (on a 2 day break) that we had to come back a second time! The food was delicious.
Good wholesome food. Friendly and welcoming staff.
A lovely wee restaurant in the centre of Armagh. Can only highly recommend this restaurant.
Hopefully we will return again.
Updated review content.

Lovely restaurant with great friendly welcoming staff, we ordered the fish and chips which were delicious also cater for gluten free which my wife is, also very reasonably priced. Only criticism was the service was slow even though there were only a few customer's in.

Went there for our son’s 40th Birthday celebrations which I had told them about when booking for 10 people. Very disappointed in preparation as it was nil. In fact I asked for table upstairs and was shown to table downstairs at the door which hadn’t room for 10 . I could say a lot more about the attitude of the guy who I think owns the restaurant but to say the least his attitude was appalling . I. sensed there was some problem which wasn’t of my making and it certainly was no way to treat paying customers. The rest of the staff were really friendly and helpful. The food which was served promptly was absolutely gorgeous and plenty of it. I had the steak sandwich and it was easily the nicest I’ve ever tasted. The chips were big and golden. and everyone commented on how lovely the food was. The bill was fine and the only thing I had a problem with the £33 service chargeI’. If it goes directly to staff then grand but customers should be given the option to pay. We always leave a generous tip in restaurants but like to have the option. I’ve  been to Embers on many occasions but after Sat night I can’t see me going back. The reason for no stars for atmosphere is because there wasn’t any.

Real wee gem of a place.nicely laid out, very pleasant staff. Great menu- food is divine.went for weekday lunch was so impressed had to try the Sunday dinner. Lots of choice , easy to book ahead, will be back for sure!!
Great place to visit!
Great place to visit!

My friend Avril and I have have had several lunches in King Street Cafe. Service is great / very friendly. The food is excellent and so reasonably priced / everything is fresh, hot and very delicious. We will certainly be back. 👍

Excellent Christmas lunch in the King street kitchen. A good plate with ham, turkey and stuffing, sprouts, turnips, mash and roast potatoes with loads of gravy and all cooked to perfection. Been there before and never been disappointed or left feeling hungry. If you are in Bangor and you want a great Christmas lunch this is the place to go.

Food is tops. Home made chips are a must have. We had the chicken goujons and cajun chicken wrap, and both were delicious for a very reasonable price. Looked this place up on Google Maps when we were taking a day trip to Bangor, and the high reviews were justified. Quaint little place off the main street.
Best fry in town, very good value and includes tea or coffee. Recommended by a friend and glad I went. The pic is of a "small fry" 🙂

Had three friends visiting from England and I took them here for lunch. First class service, food and pricing. We all ordered full plates of food and the bill for all 4 of us was only £45. This included tea and soft drinks. Highly recommended.

I used the cafe for the first time on Friday. Food, service, staff and the prices are excellent. I even left my mobile phone and bank cards behind and everything was returned to me the next day intact. They even posted a message on Facebook for me. That's service of the highest quality. Definitely highly recommend
Can’t fault it! Very friendly staff, fast service, delicious food and great prices

This was the perfect spot to meet up with visiting relatives.  Super friendly staff, and the vegetable soup was the best I've had on my travels so far.  Really enjoyed the atmosphere.  So glad we picked it!
Amazing food , great staff 😋  Ulster fry was absolutely incredible. Cappuccino was perfect and can't wait to come back here again . Thank you
Great food at a very good price.  The best thing though is the staff who could not do more to help me and my disabled wife.  A great cafe with really nice food.

I used the cafe for the first time on Friday. Food, service, staff and the prices are excellent. I even left my mobile phone and bank cards behind and everything was returned to me the next day intact. They even posted a message on Facebook for me. That's service of the highest quality. Definitely highly recommend
Can’t fault it! Very friendly staff, fast service, delicious food and great prices

This was the perfect spot to meet up with visiting relatives.  Super friendly staff, and the vegetable soup was the best I've had on my travels so far.  Really enjoyed the atmosphere.  So glad we picked it!
Amazing food , great staff 😋  Ulster fry was absolutely incredible. Cappuccino was perfect and can't wait to come back here again . Thank you
Great food at a very good price.  The best thing though is the staff who could not do more to help me and my disabled wife.  A great cafe with really nice food.

My wife and I called here on Saturday morning.I ordered a breakfast bap and my wife had eggs and toast. We also bought scones for later that evening however as they looked so tasty we sampled one with our tea. Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection. The refills of our tea made everything even better. The staff were friendly and the place was clean bright and welcoming. The scones we had later were also delicious, we took a variety of the flavours. I highly recommend Hedleys.

We called in to Hedleys on 23/07/2024, for some lunch as we were running late. We both had the "Mince meat pie" one with chips, the other with mashed potatoes. The best thing about my lunch was the chips, the pie was lacking in taste, neither carrot or onion was in it, the other lunch was just as bad but the mashed potatoes lacked seasoning.
They do a good pot of soup, and we wished we had gone with that option.

My partner and i had a fabulous breakfast at hedleys recently…it was perfectly cooked with a lovely cup of coffee…the owner phil is nothing short of a true gentleman and made us feel very welcome and comfortable…nothing was too much trouble!!! The food, service and buzzy atmosphere was second to none! We wish you well phil and brenda!! Excellent value for money!!! Thank you so much xx

My friend and I had lovely scones, tea and a tray bake yesterday, was really tasty, my scone had lots of cherries which was very pleasing. It was quite busy but we got served quickly. We will definitely return.
We got the large breakfast fry here at Hedleys Restaurant and it was so delicious! The staff were so kind and welcoming, would definitely come back next time I’m in Belfast :)
Lovely place for lunch. Steak sandwich was amazing, and the wife said the pancakes were great too. Mango smoothie also top notch

Breakfast was very good.
The latte smells strong, but it wasn't. The coffee had a taste of chocolate. I like it very much.

Went in for a coffee - Cappuccino to be exact - and was immediately struck by the 3.50 price tag. In Derry, the best specialty coffee shops are charging 3.30at most for a coffee like a cappuccino, so my expectations were definitely very high. However, the cappuccino when it arrived was huge - which I guess explains the pricing - however, it tasted more like a Latté, a weak Latté at that. The sizing was far too big and I think it would be beneficial to charge a lower price for a smaller size, or at least provide a smaller option. The coffee itself was fine, definitely not worth the premium price being charged. When I entered, initially the staff were really nice, however the staff working at the till and serving the coffee were unpleasant and seemed like they would rather be somewhere else, which ruined the atmosphere a little. I think this place could be really nice and I was planning on returning to try food some other time, however with such a mediocre experience, there are better café options elsewhere in the city.

Staff are super friendly and so accommodating.
The wait wasn't that long for food despite the cafe being very busy.

Love the interior, such character. The food was reasonably priced and was hot and tasty.

This was a wonder find. Dog friendly, great food, staff were happy, helpful and smiley.
We even got a pupcup...think it was enjoyed by pup as much as our brunch was enjoyed by us

Fantastic owner, personnel, and coffee with snacks. It's my favorite place to go as a local because of its pleasant and welcoming vibe. I've been coming here every day for the last three months, and every cup of coffee and snacks is perfect.🥰🙏❤️

I really enjoyed this place. Coming from Ukraine, finding delicious sushi in Northern Ireland is quite challenging, but we found it here! The staff is polite and welcoming. We tried the hot dog sushi, which was delicious and closely resembled what we usually have in Ukraine. Thank you for the opportunity to enjoy a tasty meal! We'll definitely be coming back!

Lovely spot for a coffee or food. We had an assorted portion of sushi, 24 large and tasty sushi rolls with a personal 3 variety choice. Great food presentation and cozy environment. I definitely recommend this.
Beautiful place and perfect atmosphere. Food was amazing. Simple omelette couldn't be made better. Best compliments to shefs and all staff! Definitely will be back again.
Absolutely mind-blowing sushi! Every bite was an explosion of flavor. The crab was incredibly fresh, beautifully presented and had all the trimmings. Highly recommend! 🍣✨
